comments.text: I've tried it on my Odin 3 and the two Mario Kart Arcade GP games work great. I had no such luck with F-Zero AX which fails to calibrate the analog sticks correctly. Pushing all the way to the left is recognized as pushing right, so in game your car starts steering left and when you get past 3/4 left it'll suddenly turn all the way to the right which makes it mostly unplayable. Using the stick as you suggested is what I endded up doing, because if you pull the sitck down as you turn left and right it prevents you from pushing all the way to the left and have the game reverse the streering direction brutally. But that's not very comfortable to play.

comments.text:
This is for version F-Zero AX Monster Ride (USA) (Cycraft):

Bypass Cycraft
0043137B 00000086

Slowdown Fix
0043137E 00000000

And since these aren't included anymore in the latest builds of Dolphin, you'll also need to add these patches (NOT Gecko Codes, Patches, its a different tab) to skip the Motor Setup screen.

[OnFrame]
$Disable Motor Setup
0x8023A0F4:dword:0x8016B4EC
0x8023A0F8:dword:0x8016B350

comments.text:
Great video, thanks for the demonstration and the tips!

Unfortunately on the AYN Thor in F Zero AX I'm getting a permanent right input whenever I move my joystick to the left. It moves to the right fine but if I hit left it goes hard right. The only way I can get it to go left is if I hold down and slight left. Hopefully this can get fixed. I even recalibrated my joysticks and checked the input checker/calibration in the service menu. Mario Kart GP 1 & 2 work flawlessly though.
